title: The AI Economy Is Focused on the Usual Superstar Cities. Let’s Fix It Now
sub_head: There are things cities, states, companies and the federal government can do to make sure urban areas get a piece of the next big thing
body:
Mark Muro (@markmuro1) is a senior fellow and policy director at the Brookings Institution.
Artificial intelligence is widely viewed as a major general purpose technology—that is, the next “big thing” in spurring productivity and technology-based economic development in the U.S.
